official-title.#text:
To amend title 23, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish an
			 innovation in surface transportation program, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Innovation in Surface Transportation Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Innovation in Surface Transportation Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in coordination with State transportation departments, shall establish an innovation
			 in surface transportation program in accordance with the requirements of
			 this section.

text.#text: The
The purposes of the program shall be—
to increase the return on investment in the Nation’s surface transportation system;

to make the Nation’s surface transportation system more reliable, safe, and efficient by advancing
			 innovative projects selected through State competitions;
to increase input from local government and stakeholders on projects receiving funding; and
to leverage Federal highway dollars further through in-State competitions.

A State shall make grants under this section to eligible entities for eligible projects to be
			 carried out in the State using funds reserved by the State for a fiscal
			 year under

For the purposes of making grants under this section, a State shall conduct a competition each
			 fiscal year under which the State will accept grant applications submitted
			 by eligible entities.
not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section; and

not later than 30 days after the first day of each fiscal year beginning after such date of
			 enactment.
A State shall conduct a competition under

The State selection panel of each State shall establish and make available to the public the
			 project selection criteria that will be used by the State in conducting
			 competitions under
improve safety for all users of the transportation network;
strengthen the contribution of a national freight network to the Nation’s economic competitiveness;
promote multimodal connectivity;
strengthen return on investment, particularly the impact on local economic development;
improve access to jobs, sources of labor, schools, and opportunity;

optimize, through better design and operation, the usage and efficiency of existing transportation
			 facilities;
improve the reliability of the transportation system of the United States;
encourage innovation and the use of technology; or
further the purposes described in

The project selection criteria of a State may provide for the approval of project applications
			 based on the extent to which the projects—

provide that special consideration in the approval of project applications is given to eligible
			 projects that—

maximize the amount of proposed project costs that can be borne by the applicant from non-Federal
			 sources; or
have prior significant Federal or non-Federal investment; and
give equal consideration to differences in the fiscal capacity of public eligible entities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the project selection criteria of a
			 State may—

text.#text: In addition to the factors specified in

The project selection criteria of a State shall take into consideration the equitable distribution
			 of funds by geography and population.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
only if the application is
			 sponsored by a public entity.

text.#text:
An eligible entity that is a private transportation provider may submit a project application in a
			 State competition conducted under

header.#text: Special rule for private transportation providers
Innovation in surface transportation selection panel

text.#text:
A State, in coordination with local transportation stakeholders, shall establish an innovation in
			 surface transportation selection panel in accordance with this subsection.
A State selection panel shall—
review project applications submitted to the State during a competition conducted under
approve and disapprove the project applications based on the criteria set forth in
A State selection panel shall be composed of the following members to be appointed by the State—
not fewer than 3 individuals representing the State’s transportation department;

not fewer than 3 individuals representing local governments in the State, with at least 1
			 representative from each of—
a jurisdiction with a population of 50,000 individuals or fewer;

a jurisdiction with a population of more than 50,000 individuals and not more than 1,000,000
			 individuals; and
a jurisdiction with a population of more than 1,000,000 individuals, if applicable; and

not fewer than 3 individuals representing metropolitan planning organizations, councils of
			 governments, and rural planning organizations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a State selection panel shall be composed
			 of 9 members to be appointed by the State, in coordination with local
			 transportation stakeholders, from among individuals representing—

text.#text: In addition to the members appointed under
local chambers of commerce;

transportation management organizations, travel and tourism boards, economic development
			 organizations, and other coalitions of employers and commerce;
local air quality boards or local organizations supporting improved air quality;
State safety boards or local organizations supporting safety;
transit agencies;
port authorities, if applicable;
active transportation organizations;
public interest organizations; and
labor unions.
A State shall appoint members to the State’s selection panel in a manner such that—
the number of members appointed under each of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from each of the entities described in

text.#text: at least 1 member is appointed under
The members of a State selection panel shall be geographically diverse, to the extent practicable.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, no entity may be
			 represented on a State selection panel for more than 2 consecutive years
			 if a comparable entity can also be represented on the panel.

text.#text: Except for the representatives described in

A State shall appoint members to the State’s selection panel using a 2-tiered rotation process that
			 ensures continuity of the panel by rotating the membership of the panel on
			 a staggered basis.
On October 1 of each fiscal year, a State shall make the following reservations of funds:
for carrying out State competitions under this section; and
for making grants under this section for eligible projects.
The State shall reserve 10 percent of the amount apportioned to the State for the fiscal year under

In this section, the following definitions apply:
The term
a local government;
a regional transportation authority;
a transit agency;
a tribal government;
a private provider of public transportation;
a nonprofit transportation organization;
a port authority;
a joint power authority; or
a local rail authority.
The term
a project eligible under—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , relating to the surface transportation program;

, relating to the transportation alternatives program; or

text.#text:
a surface transportation project that will improve the movement of goods along a primary freight
			 network, including multimodal facilities near a primary freight route.

text.#text: The term

Not later than 30 days after a State has selected projects for a fiscal year to receive funding
			 under this section, the State shall make available, in a
			 publically accessible medium that is easy to navigate—
the criteria and methodology used to select the projects;
a list of all the projects for which funding was requested, including, for each such project—
the total estimated project cost; and
the amount of funding requested;

a list of projects that were selected to receive funding under this section, including, for each
			 such project—
the amount of funding requested;
the amount of funding granted; and
the source of the non-Federal share of cost of the project; and
the ranking and scoring of all projects for which funding was requested.
Not later than 180 days after the last day of each fiscal year, a State shall submit to the
the information required under
the organizations that were represented on the State’s selection panel;
the portion of the funds available to the State for the program that have been obligated; and

the percentage of the funds available to the State for the program that were used for
			 administrative expenses.
